tp.pr5

Class City

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr5.City
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockCity

    public class City
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the city where the robot is wandering.
    It contains information about the streets and the places in the city
    Author:
    Abel Serrano Juste

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Shop cityShop 
      private Place initialPlace 
      private org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractBaseGraph<Place,Street> map 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      City()
      Default constructor.
      City(Street[] cityMap)
      Creates a city using an array of streets
      City(Street[] cityMap, Place[] placeMap)
      Auxiliary way to create new City, this way from two arrays of Street and of Place.
      All source/target place on streets definition have to be present on placeMap, otherwise it throws a runtime exception.
      City(Street[] streetMap, Place[] placeMap, Shop stockItems) 
      City(Street[] streetMap, Shop stockItems)

    • Constructor Detail

      • City

        public City()
        Default constructor. Needed for testing purposes

      • City

        public City(Street[] cityMap)
        Creates a city using an array of streets
        Parameters:
        cityMap - Array of streets which describes the city map.

      • City

        public City(Street[] cityMap,
    Place[] placeMap)
        Auxiliary way to create new City, this way from two arrays of Street and of Place.
        All source/target place on streets definition have to be present on placeMap, otherwise it throws a runtime exception.
        Parameters:
        cityMap - Array of streets which describes the road map.
        placeMap - Array of Places which describes the sites where wall·e can stop.

      • City

    Shop stockItems)

    Place[] placeMap,

    • Method Detail

      • lookForStreet

        public Street lookForStreet(Place currentPlace,
                   Direction currentHeading)
        Looks for the street that starts from the given place in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        currentPlace - The place where to look for the street
        currentHeading - The direction to look for the street
        Returns:
        The street that stars from the given place in the given direction. It returns null if there is not any street in this direction from the given place

      • getTouchingStreetsTo

        public java.util.Set<Street> getTouchingStreetsTo(Place p)
        This method returns a set up to 4 streets which are touching the place given.
        It's interesting to use for advancing the next possible streets
        Parameters:
        p - place to looking for touching streets
        Returns:
        Set up to 4 streets connected to the Place p.

        public Place getInitialPlace()
        Returns the place where the robot will start the simulation
